alert.note: Alert for Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 4:59AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Geneva and Houston. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 459 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dothan, Taylor, Kinsey, Cowarts, Webb, Green Acres, W. Main/brannon St, Jones Crossroads, Ardilla, Smyrna, Wilson Mill, Bailey Crossroad and Wicksburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
